SEARCH
Package uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop

Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.leedsbeckett.oop.GameWorld
public class GameWorld extends Object
The game world containing a 2D grid of cells and game objects.

Think of GameWorld as the "game board" for the railway simulation. It's a rectangular grid made up of cells (like squares on a checkerboard). Each cell can contain:

  • Background (like grass)
  • Track pieces (straight rails, corners, crossings)
  • Signals (traffic lights for trains)

The GameWorld also keeps track of all the vehicles (locomotives and carriages) in the simulation and provides methods to:

  • Check if a position is valid (inside the grid)
  • Get or set what's at a particular position
  • Find tracks, signals, and vehicles
  • Create a complete railway layout with tracks

The grid uses (x, y) coordinates where:

  • x = column number (0 is leftmost)
  • y = row number (0 is topmost)

    • createRectangularRailwayWorld

      public static GameWorld.RailwayWorldData createRectangularRailwayWorld()
      Creates a rectangular railway track layout with crossings and returns the complete world.

      This is a "factory method" - a special method that creates and returns a complete GameWorld that's ready to use. You don't have to build the world yourself piece by piece; this method does all the hard work for you:

      • Creates a 21x15 grid
      • Fills the background with grass
      • Builds a rectangular track around the outside
      • Adds a vertical track through the middle
      • Creates two crossing points where tracks meet
      • Loads all the graphics (images)

      Think of this like ordering a "complete railway starter set" - you get everything you need in one package.

      Returns:
      a RailwayWorldData object containing the world and references to the two crossing tracks

    • setVehicleImages

      public void setVehicleImages(BufferedImage newLocoImage, BufferedImage newCarriageImage)
      Replaces the vehicle images with custom PNG graphics.

      This method allows you to customize how locomotives and carriages look by providing your own PNG images. The images you provide should point WEST (left), and this method will automatically create rotated versions for all four directions (SOUTH, EAST, NORTH).

      What This Does:

      1. Takes your custom locomotive and carriage images
      2. Creates 4 rotated versions of each (one for each compass direction)
      3. Updates the GameImages so new images are used when rendering vehicles

      Important Notes:

      • Your images should face WEST (pointing left) in the original PNG file
      • Images should be 32x32 pixels to match the game's cell size
      • Both parameters must be non-null (use ImageUtil.loadImage(java.lang.String, java.awt.Color, java.lang.String) to load PNGs)
      • Changes take effect immediately - next render will use new images

      Example Usage: 

       // Load custom images from files
 BufferedImage myLoco = ImageUtil.loadImage("my_locomotive.png", Color.RED, "L");
 BufferedImage myCarriage = ImageUtil.loadImage("my_carriage.png", Color.BLUE, "C");
 
 // Replace the default images
 world.setVehicleImages(myLoco, myCarriage);
 
 // Now all locomotives and carriages will use your custom graphics!
      Parameters:
      newLocoImage - the new locomotive image pointing WEST (must not be null)
      newCarriageImage - the new carriage image pointing WEST (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either image is null
